title: Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and rain forecasted as dense fog disrupts flights and trains - Moneycontrol
summary:
Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and Rain Forecast as Fog Disrupts Services

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Delhi experienced dense fog and cold wave conditions, affecting flights and train services significantly.

  • Over 100 flights were delayed at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to low visibility.
  • The IMD issued a yellow alert predicting thunderstorms and rain.
  • Fog visibility in Delhi and surrounding areas was less than 50 meters in some regions.
Visibility reduced to zero as a blanket of dense fog witnessed in parts of Delhi-NCR.

The weather conditions are expected to continue impacting travel and air quality.
newTitle: Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and Rain Forecast as Fog Disrupts Services

title: Woman hangs herself from electric pole, husband found dead in Ghaziabad home after marital spat - The Times of India
Woman hangs herself from electric pole, husband found dead in Ghaziabad home after marital spat - The Times of India
Wife Can Claim Maintenance From Husband Even If She Doesn't Live With Him As Per Decree On Conjugal... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Rules Wife Can Claim Maintenance Without Residing with Husband

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Live Law

In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court stated that a wife is entitled to claim maintenance even if she refuses to live with her husband, despite a decree of restitution of conjugal rights.

  • The Court highlighted that a husband cannot deny maintenance simply because his wife does not live with him.
  • The ruling stemmed from a case where the wife suffered mistreatment and a miscarriage, justifying her refusal to return to the matrimonial home.
  • The husband's argument that the wife’s non-compliance with the decree exempted him from paying maintenance was rejected by the Court.
  • The Court emphasized that Section 125 Cr.P.C. exists to prevent destitution and applies regardless of marital disputes.
“Dinesh's attempts to evade responsibility clearly reflect a lack of bona fides,” the Court observed.

The Supreme Court reversed the Jharkhand High Court’s earlier decision, reaffirming the right of the wife to maintenance.
newTitle: Supreme Court Rules Wife Can Claim Maintenance Without Residing with Husband

title: 'Damage control': Congress mocks PM Modi's 'not a God' remark in his first podcast appearance - The Times of India
Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital - News18
summary:
Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: News18

A tragic incident at Midnapore Medical College and Hospital involves the administration of expired saline, leading to the death of a pregnant woman and critically ill conditions for five others.

  • A 10-member inquiry committee from the West Bengal Health Department will investigate the incident.
  • The health department has ordered the replacement of the current saline stock.
  • The deceased, Mamoni Rui Das (21), had given birth shortly before her condition deteriorated.
  • Opposition parties criticized the state government over the incident, demanding accountability.
“Shame on the crumbling healthcare system in West Bengal under the disastrous regime of @MamataOfficial! A pregnant woman DIED after being given EXPIRED saline at a govt hospital in Midnapore, and several others now fight for their lives.” — BJP West Bengal

This incident raises significant concerns about healthcare standards in West Bengal, demanding immediate governmental accountability and reform.
newTitle: Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital

title: Madhya Pradesh: IT officials find crocodiles during raid on former BJP MLA's house - Hindustan Times
summary:
Crocodiles Discovered During IT Raid on Former BJP MLA's Property in Madhya Pradesh

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Income Tax officials raiding the property of former BJP MLA Harvansh Singh Rathore in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district were astonished to discover crocodiles on the premises, alongside significant tax evasion findings.

  • The raid was linked to alleged tax evasion amounting to ₹155 crore.
  • IT officials seized ₹3 crore in cash and various valuables including gold and silver jewellery.
  • The reptiles were found in a pond and were rescued with the involvement of the forest department.
  • Rajesh Kesarwani, Rathore's business associate, is reportedly at the center of the tax evasion case.
  • The health of the rescued crocodiles is currently under examination.
“The health of the crocodiles is being examined. We will inform the court about them and proceed accordingly.”

This incident highlights the unusual circumstances surrounding the tax evasion case, blending wildlife concerns with financial misconduct.
newTitle: Crocodiles Discovered During IT Raid on Former BJP MLA's Property in Madhya Pradesh

AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi dies after ‘accidentally’ shooting himself, says police - The Hindu
summary:
AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi dies after ‘accidentally’ shooting himself, says police

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Gurpreet Bassi Gogi has died from gunshot injuries, reportedly from an accidental discharge of his own licensed pistol.

  • Gurpreet Gogi sustained injuries to his head around midnight.
  • He was declared dead upon arrival at DMC hospital.
  • Deputy Commissioner of Police stated it appears to be a case of accidental fire.
  • A cause of death will be confirmed after the post-mortem report.
  • Gogi joined AAP in 2022, winning against former Congress MLA Bharat Bhushan Ashu.
“Cause of the death will be clear once the post-mortem reports come.” - Deputy Commissioner of Police Jaskaran Singh

Investigations are ongoing into the circumstances surrounding Gogi's death.
newTitle: AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi dies from accidental gunshot, police say

title: AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi shoots himself accidentally, declared dead - The Hindu
summary:
AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi Accidentally Shoots Himself and is Declared Dead

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Gurpreet Gogi has been pronounced dead after accidentally shooting himself, resulting in serious head injuries. The incident took place around midnight.

  • Gurpreet Gogi sustained bullet injuries to his head and was declared dead at the hospital.
  • The Deputy Commissioner of Police stated that the shooting was accidental as per family accounts.
  • The cause of death will be confirmed once the post-mortem report is available.
  • Gogi, who joined AAP in 2022, previously defeated a two-time Congress MLA during the Ludhiana assembly elections.
“The incident happened around midnight, and he was declared dead when he was brought to the DMC hospital...” - DCP Jaskaran Singh

Further investigations into the incident are currently underway.
newTitle: AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi Accidentally Shoots Himself and is Declared Dead

title: Dense fog in parts of Delhi, Noida, rain, thunderstorm expected today; Flight ops normal - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dense Fog Causes Flight and Train Delays in Delhi and Noida

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Moderate to dense fog continues to impact flight and train operations in Delhi and surrounding areas, with more than 100 flights and several trains delayed.

  • Impact on Transportation: Delhi's IGI airport issued multiple advisories for passengers to check flight statuses due to dense fog causing delays.
  • Weather Conditions: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasted light rain and thunderstorms over the weekend amidst the fog.
  • Air Quality Index: AQI reached 'severe' levels, going above 400.
  • Train Delays: 45 trains experienced delays due to low visibility conditions.
  • Accidents: Reduced visibility led to multiple accidents including a serious incident involving a bus collision with a truck.
“Fog reduced visibility to zero in parts of Delhi, Ghaziabad, Noida and other areas of the national capital region.”

The combination of dense fog and poor air quality has led to significant disruptions in travel across Delhi and Noida, emphasizing the need for weather preparedness and caution among commuters.
newTitle: Dense Fog Causes Flight and Train Delays in Delhi and Noida

title: Delhi-NCR foggy, rain expected; flight and train operations likely to be hit again - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi-NCR foggy, rain expected; flight and train operations likely to be hit again

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The national capital is experiencing dense fog, which severely reduced visibility, causing over 100 flights and several train services to be delayed. The weather is expected to continue affecting transportation, with rain predicted over the weekend.

  • Flight and train delays: Zero visibility due to fog has significantly disrupted flight and train operations, leading to multiple advisories issued by IGI airport.
  • Rain predictions: Light rain and thunderstorms are anticipated, with current temperatures below normal.
  • Air Quality Index (AQI): The AQI reached 'severe' levels, peaking at 409 due to high pollution levels.
  • Accidents linked to fog: Multiple accidents occurred due to low visibility, causing injuries and fatalities.
"Dense fog was seen in parts of Delhi on Saturday morning, leading to the delay of 100 flights and several trains."

Overall, the persistent fog and deteriorating air quality continue to pose challenges for residents and transportation in the Delhi-NCR region.
newTitle: Delhi-NCR Fog Causes Disruptions in Flight and Train Operations

title: Mumbai: Ukrainian masterminds fled India under garb of Christmas leave - The Indian Express
summary:
Torres Fraud: Ukrainian Masterminds Flee India During Christmas Leave

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Indian Express

An investigation by the Mumbai police Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has found that the two suspected Ukrainian masterminds of the Torres investment fraud case escaped the country in December 2024 after telling staff and agents they were going on Christmas leave.

  • Victoriia Kovalenko and Olena Stoian are suspected masterminds behind the fraud.
  • The EOW is investigating links to a similar mass fraud in Turkey.
  • Three additional arrests have been made in relation to the Ponzi scheme.
  • A substantial amount of cash has been seized during the investigation, including Rs 5 crore from multiple locations.
  • A heated argument at the Dadar store revealed financial irregularities, prompting investor action.
  • A gathering of around 600 investors led to police intervention and subsequent filing of an FIR.
“Angry staffers alerted close investors, who rushed to the store.”

The ongoing investigation has raised questions about the internal operations of Torres and its leadership, highlighting the need for greater scrutiny in financial dealings.
newTitle: Torres Fraud: Ukrainian Masterminds Flee India During Christmas Leave

summary:
AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi Found Dead from Gunshot Wound

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi from Ludhiana West was declared dead due to a gunshot wound late Friday night, with the cause of death still under investigation.

  • Gurpreet Gogi Bassi was declared dead on arrival at Dayanand Medical College and Hospital.
  • An autopsy will confirm if his death was due to suicide or accidental firing.
  • Bassi had recently participated in community activities, including a cleanliness drive.
  • He joined AAP in 2022, defeating a two-time MLA in the elections.
“The cause of death is yet to be determined,” said commissioner Kuldeep Singh Chahal.

This tragic incident raises concerns about the safety of politicians and the circumstances surrounding such incidents in Punjab.
newTitle: AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi Found Dead from Gunshot Wound

title: Delhi: Smog causes travel chaos in Indian capital - BBC.com
summary:
Delhi: Smog causes travel chaos in Indian capital

Date: [Publication Date] Source: BBC News

The capital of India is facing significant travel disruptions due to dense fog and severe air pollution levels, particularly affecting flights, trains, and road transport.

Key points include:

  • Visibility in Delhi reached near zero early Friday.
  • Over 150 flights have been delayed, and numerous trains are running late.
  • Air quality index soared above 400, more than 25 times the WHO safe limit.
  • Authorities have reinstated pollution control measures, including online schooling and halting construction activities.
  • Passengers reported significant chaos at the airport, with unclear boarding information.
  • Weather forecasts predict improvements in visibility due to light showers over the weekend.
"No display of boarding gate and it seems no one knows the exact status," a frustrated passenger commented.

This recurring winter issue in northern India raises serious concerns regarding air quality and public health, emphasizing the need for long-term solutions.
newTitle: Delhi Smog Disrupts Travel as Air Quality Plummets

summary:
Kerala Girl Claims Sexual Abuse by 64 People Over 4 Years; 5 Held

Date: October 2023 Source: Local News

A young girl in Kerala has made disturbing allegations of being sexually abused by 64 different individuals over a span of four years. Authorities have arrested five suspects in connection with these allegations.

  • The girl reported the incidents to local authorities, leading to an investigation.
  • The allegations include a wide array of individuals from varying backgrounds.
  • Community leaders have called for stricter measures to protect children.
  • Authorities are working to corroborate the claims and identify additional perpetrators.
“We must ensure the safety of our children and bring to justice anyone who harms them,” said a community leader.

The case has sparked outrage in the community, emphasizing the need for more robust child protection laws.

title: SC stays execution of Sambhal civic body’s ‘notice’ on well near Shahi Jama Masjid - The Indian Express
summary:
Supreme Court Stops Notice on Sambhal Mosque Well, Requests Status Report

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: The Indian Express

There will be no worship or holy bath at the well near the Shahi Jama Masjid in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, as the Supreme Court has temporarily halted a municipal notice related to the well.

The Supreme Court ordered a status report in two weeks on the notice issued by Sambhal municipal authorities concerning the well located near the mosque. The UP government claims the well is on government land.

  • The Supreme Court stayed execution of a municipal notice regarding the well.
  • The mosque management committee disputes the characterization of the well's location.
  • A historical dispute exists between Hindus and Muslims over the mosque's origins.
  • Violence erupted over previous claims involving a survey of the mosque.
  • A significant number of old temples and wells have reportedly been revived by local authorities.
“We have been drawing water from the well since time immemorial.” - Huzefa Ahmadi, Senior Advocate

The court is monitoring the situation to maintain peace and harmony amidst the ongoing dispute.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stops Notice on Sambhal Mosque Well, Requests Status Report

title: Class 3 girl dies of suspected cardiac arrest in Ahmedabad school - The Indian Express
summary:
Class 3 Girl Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest in Ahmedabad School

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

An eight-year-old girl collapsed and died within minutes due to suspected cardiac arrest on Friday morning at a private school in Ahmedabad. Police are probing the incident to ascertain the exact cause of death.

  • Gargi Tushar Ranpara arrived at Zebar School for Children and climbed the stairs to her classroom.
  • CCTV footage showed her feeling uneasy and then sitting down before collapsing.
  • Teachers administered CPR and rushed her to Zydus Hospital, but she was pronounced dead shortly after arriving.
  • Gargi's parents were in Mumbai at the time of the incident, and she was with her grandparents.
  • The school is providing support to her family and classmates.
“Despite their efforts, the doctors informed us that she suffered a cardiac arrest and was pronounced dead shortly after arriving at the hospital.”

The tragic incident highlights the need for increased awareness and preventive measures regarding health issues in children.
newTitle: Class 3 Girl Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest in Ahmedabad School

title: Assam mining tragedy: Head of labourers held - The Arunachal Times
summary:
Assam Mining Tragedy: Arrest Made as Rescue Operations Continue

Date: 10 Jan | Source: Guwahati

The head of workers at the coal mine in Assam’s Dima Hasao district has been arrested as rescue operations to save trapped miners continue amidst grim circumstances.

  • The 'sardar' or head of the miners, Hanan Laskar, was arrested after fleeing the site following the incident on January 6.
  • One body has been recovered, and eight miners remain trapped in a flooded quarry.
  • Rescue operations are being conducted by divers from the Navy and Army after dewatering efforts are in place.
  • The quarry is believed to be operating illegally.
“The fate of the trapped miners appeared to be grim,” an official stated.

The ongoing rescue efforts involve multiple agencies, including the Navy, Army, and civil administration, as they race against time to find the trapped laborers.
newTitle: Assam Mining Tragedy: Arrest Made as Rescue Operations Continue

title: "Baseless Allegation, Flared Up Emotions": Kuki Village Chief Denies Woman Assaulted Over Land In Manipur - NDTV
summary:
Kuki Village Chief Denies Assault Allegation in Manipur Land Dispute

Published on: Not specified
Source: NDTV

A Kuki village chief dismissed claims that a woman was assaulted over a land-building issue in Manipur, urging the public not to be misled by what he describes as unfounded allegations.

  • The woman and her brother alleged they were assaulted by Kuki tribesmen while attempting to build a house in K Lungwiram Naga village.
  • Haopu Vaiphei, the village chief, stated that police intervened to prevent misunderstandings at the site.
  • He suggested the incident escalated emotions in the community due to the woman's claims.
  • A hearing regarding the land dispute has been scheduled for January 10, as investigations continue.
  • The civil society group WKZIC condemned the “quit notice” era to Kukis issued by local authorities amid the dispute.
“It was unfortunate that the said lady... made a video clip alleging physical assault which was totally baseless.” — Haopu Vaiphei

This situation underlines rising tensions in Manipur over land ownership issues and reflects the complexities within tribal claims and local governance in the region.
newTitle: Kuki Village Chief Denies Assault Allegation in Manipur Land Dispute
